com.uber.autodispose.lifecycle

Class LifecycleScopes

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uber.autodispose.lifecycle.LifecycleScopes

  • public final class LifecycleScopes
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for dealing with LifecycleScopeProviders. This includes factories for resolving Completable representations of scopes, corresponding events, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • resolveScopeFromLifecycle

        public static <E> CompletableSource resolveScopeFromLifecycle(LifecycleScopeProvider<E> provider)
                                                       throws OutsideScopeException
        Overload for resolving lifecycle providers that defaults to checking start and end boundaries of lifecycles. That is, they will ensure that the lifecycle has both started and not ended.

        Note: This resolves the scope immediately, so consider deferring execution as needed, such as using defer.

        Type Parameters:
        E - the lifecycle event type
        Parameters:
        provider - the LifecycleScopeProvider to resolve.
        Returns:
        a resolved CompletableSource representation of a given provider
        Throws:
        OutsideScopeException - if the LifecycleScopeProvider.correspondingEvents() throws an OutsideScopeException during resolution.

      • resolveScopeFromLifecycle

        public static <E> CompletableSource resolveScopeFromLifecycle(LifecycleScopeProvider<E> provider,
                                                              boolean checkEndBoundary)
                                                       throws OutsideScopeException
        Overload for resolving lifecycle providers allows configuration of checking "end" boundaries of lifecycles. That is, they will ensure that the lifecycle has both started and not ended, and otherwise will throw one of LifecycleNotStartedException (if peekLifecycle returns null) or LifecycleEndedException if the lifecycle is ended. To configure the runtime behavior of these exceptions, see AutoDisposePlugins.

        Note: This resolves the scope immediately, so consider deferring execution as needed, such as using defer.

        Type Parameters:
        E - the lifecycle event type
        Parameters:
        provider - the LifecycleScopeProvider to resolve.
        checkEndBoundary - whether or not to check that the lifecycle has ended
        Returns:
        a resolved CompletableSource representation of a given provider
        Throws:
        OutsideScopeException - if the LifecycleScopeProvider.correspondingEvents() throws an OutsideScopeException during resolution.

      • resolveScopeFromLifecycle

        public static <E> CompletableSource resolveScopeFromLifecycle(<any> lifecycle,
                                                              E endEvent)
        Type Parameters:
        E - the lifecycle event type
        Parameters:
        lifecycle - the stream of lifecycle events
        endEvent - the target end event
        Returns:
        a resolved Completable representation of a given lifecycle, targeting the given event

      • resolveScopeFromLifecycle

        public static <E> CompletableSource resolveScopeFromLifecycle(<any> lifecycle,
                                                              E endEvent,
                                                              java.util.Comparator<E> comparator)
        Type Parameters:
        E - the lifecycle event type
        Parameters:
        lifecycle - the stream of lifecycle events
        endEvent - the target end event
        comparator - an optional comparator for checking event equality.
        Returns:
        a resolved Completable representation of a given lifecycle, targeting the given event
